content: Certainly. Depending on additional distance it’s likely not worth going to another store for just one item. Although you may find, as I did, that many non-packaged ingredients are available for much less than you’re used to paying. I don’t know about the online thing; definitely look into it, but last time I looked (years ago now) I couldn’t find sufficiently small quantities of spices to be worth it. Even if the price per pound is excellent, it’s hard to justify buying a pound of cardamom. I wasn’t going to bother following up, but I came across the price I last paid for steel cut oats, which I intentionally left out of my first comment because I didn’t trust my memory. In 2012 in a spice shop in *Manhattan*, I paid $1.50/lb. for a 1 lb. bag of organic steel-cut oats. So there’s that, for a relatively apples-to-apples comparison.
